description: From French terrifique, and its source, Latin terrificus (“terrifying”), from terrere (“to frighten, terrify”) + -ficus, from facere (“to make”).

adjectives.description: terrific (comparative more terrific, superlative most terrific)

entries.meaning: (now rare) Terrifying, causing terror; terrible; sublime, awe-inspiring. [from 17th c.]
Very strong or intense; excessive, tremendous. [from 18th c.]
examples: The car came round the bend at a terrific speed.
I've got a terrific hangover this morning.
I say! She's a terrific tennis player.
